info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:56PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
At 356 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from 27 miles north of Broken Bow to over Horatio, or extending from 31 miles northwest of De Queen to over Horatio, moving southwest at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... De Queen, Horatio, Broken Bow, Lockesburg, Winthrop, Arkinda, Eagletown, Hochatown, West Line, Goodwater, Cerrogordo, West Otis, Shinewell, Oak Hill, Bokhoma, Moon, Sherwood, America and Mount Herman.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
If on or near Broken Bow Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
